Great Queen of India

Rudrama Devi was one of the few female rulers in Indian history. Her father Ganapatideva raised her as a son and gave her the name 'Rudradeva'. She suppressed rebellions by feudatories regarding her gender and repelled invasions by the Yadavas.

ЁЯМН
Marco Polo's Visit

The Venetian traveler Marco Polo visited the Kakatiya empire during her reign and praised her efficient administration and justice. She strengthened the defenses of the Warangal fort.
